id: Loans.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.
name: Loans.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.

id: relates a loan to a period of time in months after which there is no prepayment penalty
name: relates a loan to a period of time in months after which there is no prepayment penalty

id: loan granted based on the strength of the borrower's credit history or reputation in the community
name: loan granted based on the strength of the borrower's credit history or reputation in the community

id: first position in the order of seniority in which the law recognizes lenders' claims against a property
name: first position in the order of seniority in which the law recognizes lenders' claims against a property

id: indicates whether the contractual terms include or would have included repayment of the outstanding principal sum at the end of a loan period, prior to which only partial or no payments were made on the principal
name: indicates whether the contractual terms include or would have included repayment of the outstanding principal sum at the end of a loan period, prior to which only partial or no payments were made on the principal

id: ratio of the total amount of debt that is secured by the asset(s) and the appraised value of the asset(s) securing the financing
name: ratio of the total amount of debt that is secured by the asset(s) and the appraised value of the asset(s) securing the financing

id: secondary or lower position in the order of seniority in which the law recognizes lenders' claims against a property
name: secondary or lower position in the order of seniority in which the law recognizes lenders' claims against a property

id: ratio, expressed as a percentage, between the principal amount of the loan and the appraised value of the asset securing the financing
name: ratio, expressed as a percentage, between the principal amount of the loan and the appraised value of the asset securing the financing

id: classifier indicating whether the lender has the primary lien position with respect to an asset used as collateral for the loan
name: classifier indicating whether the lender has the primary lien position with respect to an asset used as collateral for the loan

id: This ontology is the top-level, and most fundamental ontology for the LOAN module, extending the Debt ontology to define concepts common to all loans. It includes the primary obligations to fund the loan and to pay it back according to payment schedules. Kinds of loans covered in this ontology include open and closed end, secured and unsecured.
name: This ontology is the top-level, and most fundamental ontology for the LOAN module, extending the Debt ontology to define concepts common to all loans. It includes the primary obligations to fund the loan and to pay it back according to payment schedules. Kinds of loans covered in this ontology include open and closed end, secured and unsecured.

id: relates a loan to the financial service provider that services it
name: relates a loan to the financial service provider that services it

id: Loans.rdf version of this ontology was modified to replace content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).
name: Loans.rdf version of this ontology was modified to replace content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).

id: indicates whether or not another borrower may assume the payments on this loan
name: indicates whether or not another borrower may assume the payments on this loan

id: debt instrument whereby one party extends money or credit to another party (or parties) with the understanding that the borrowed money will be repaid according to the terms of the contract
name: debt instrument whereby one party extends money or credit to another party (or parties) with the understanding that the borrowed money will be repaid according to the terms of the contract

id: There is a credit limit most of the time, with exceptions including reverse mortgages with tenure payment. The borrower has the option of paying off the outstanding balance, without penalty, or making installment payments.
name: There is a credit limit most of the time, with exceptions including reverse mortgages with tenure payment. The borrower has the option of paying off the outstanding balance, without penalty, or making installment payments.

id: indicates the nominal amount of the loan that must be paid at or before maturity
name: indicates the nominal amount of the loan that must be paid at or before maturity

id: Differences between a co-maker and co-borrower include: (1) a co-maker is not listed on the title of the asset to which the loan applies, (2) a co-maker does not have any legal ownership rights to the asset, and (3) the co-maker does not make regular payments on the loan unless the primary borrower(s) fails to do so.
name: Differences between a co-maker and co-borrower include: (1) a co-maker is not listed on the title of the asset to which the loan applies, (2) a co-maker does not have any legal ownership rights to the asset, and (3) the co-maker does not make regular payments on the loan unless the primary borrower(s) fails to do so.

id: indicates whether the obligation arising from the covered loan was, or in the case of an application, would have been initially payable to the financial institution
name: indicates whether the obligation arising from the covered loan was, or in the case of an application, would have been initially payable to the financial institution

id: specifies the maximum amount of funds that may be borrowed (e.g. for line of credit)
name: specifies the maximum amount of funds that may be borrowed (e.g. for line of credit)

id: indicates what the balance should be after a scheduled payment is made according to contract terms
name: indicates what the balance should be after a scheduled payment is made according to contract terms

id: The asset may still be subject to government regulations such as property taxes, and the owner can place voluntary encumbrances on the real estate including its use as collateral for a loan. In the case of a mortgage, fee simple can be contrasted with lease ownership, in which case the owners have complete access to the land, but they do not own it. Owners of single-family residences typically have fee simple ownership, but condo and many townhouse owners do not, as they own their individual unit but not the land on which the development is built.
name: The asset may still be subject to government regulations such as property taxes, and the owner can place voluntary encumbrances on the real estate including its use as collateral for a loan. In the case of a mortgage, fee simple can be contrasted with lease ownership, in which case the owners have complete access to the land, but they do not own it. Owners of single-family residences typically have fee simple ownership, but condo and many townhouse owners do not, as they own their individual unit but not the land on which the development is built.

id: A value of zero means no prepayment penalty; this avoids need for a separate boolean property about whether there is a prepayment penalty
name: A value of zero means no prepayment penalty; this avoids need for a separate boolean property about whether there is a prepayment penalty

id: credit agreement in which the loan principal cannot be increased after funds are dispersed in full when the loan closes
name: credit agreement in which the loan principal cannot be increased after funds are dispersed in full when the loan closes

id: ISO 10962, Securities and related financial instruments - Classification of financial instruments (CFI) code, Fourth Edition, 2019.
name: ISO 10962, Securities and related financial instruments - Classification of financial instruments (CFI) code, Fourth Edition, 2019.

id: indicates the total the amount paid at the closing of a real estate transaction, i.e., at the time when the title to the property is conveyed (transferred) to the buyer
name: indicates the total the amount paid at the closing of a real estate transaction, i.e., at the time when the title to the property is conveyed (transferred) to the buyer

id: principal repayment terms related to payment of the loan prior to maturity
name: principal repayment terms related to payment of the loan prior to maturity

id: step down loans that are fixed rate but whose rate changes after a pre-determined number of months.
name: step down loans that are fixed rate but whose rate changes after a pre-determined number of months.

id: Loans.rdf version of this ontology was modified to move certain terms athat are general debt schedule terms to the Debt ontology (FBC-317).
name: Loans.rdf version of this ontology was modified to move certain terms athat are general debt schedule terms to the Debt ontology (FBC-317).

id: Loan payment schedules may or may not be amortization schedules, i.e., they may or may not include principal.
name: Loan payment schedules may or may not be amortization schedules, i.e., they may or may not include principal.

id: loan in which the borrower pledges some asset via a security agreement as collateral for the loan, or that is secured via third-party guarantee
name: loan in which the borrower pledges some asset via a security agreement as collateral for the loan, or that is secured via third-party guarantee

id: Closing costs may be incurred by either the buyer or the seller, and may include fees paid by either or both parties for the preparation and recording of documents, title service costs, such as for title search and insurance (typically paid by the seller, depending on the jurisdiction), other recording costs, other document or transaction stamps or taxes, brokerage commissions, survey, appraisal, inspection and other such fees, home warranties, private mortgage insurance (PMI), and so forth.
name: Closing costs may be incurred by either the buyer or the seller, and may include fees paid by either or both parties for the preparation and recording of documents, title service costs, such as for title search and insurance (typically paid by the seller, depending on the jurisdiction), other recording costs, other document or transaction stamps or taxes, brokerage commissions, survey, appraisal, inspection and other such fees, home warranties, private mortgage insurance (PMI), and so forth.

id: Loans.rdf version of this ontology was modified to correct the distinction between amortization schedule and loan payment schedule and move security agreement to the debt ontology (LOAN-168) and eliminate elements that have been deprecated for more than six months (FND-386).
name: Loans.rdf version of this ontology was modified to correct the distinction between amortization schedule and loan payment schedule and move security agreement to the debt ontology (LOAN-168) and eliminate elements that have been deprecated for more than six months (FND-386).

id: classifier indicating the nature of the applicant's or borrower's ownership or leasehold interest in an asset used as collateral for the loan
name: classifier indicating the nature of the applicant's or borrower's ownership or leasehold interest in an asset used as collateral for the loan

id: regular or explicit (ad hoc) payment schedule associated with a given loan-specific account
name: regular or explicit (ad hoc) payment schedule associated with a given loan-specific account

id: classification indicating the most common type of ownership, covering an indefinite ownership period and the freedom to transfer said ownership as desired
name: classification indicating the most common type of ownership, covering an indefinite ownership period and the freedom to transfer said ownership as desired

id: exposure, as they can be compelled to honor the debt much sooner and regardless of whether certain conditions are met.
name: exposure, as they can be compelled to honor the debt much sooner and regardless of whether certain conditions are met.

id: secured loan that is secured with cash or other acceptable collateral (real property, securities or other assets) provided by the borrower as specified in the collateral agreement
name: secured loan that is secured with cash or other acceptable collateral (real property, securities or other assets) provided by the borrower as specified in the collateral agreement

id: The loan may require regular payments that pay down principal periodically, or it may require the full payment of principal at maturity.
name: The loan may require regular payments that pay down principal periodically, or it may require the full payment of principal at maturity.

id: credit agreement that may be extended up to an agreed credit limit and paid down at any time within the period of the line, if any, and on which interest is charged only on the outstanding balance
name: credit agreement that may be extended up to an agreed credit limit and paid down at any time within the period of the line, if any, and on which interest is charged only on the outstanding balance

id: actual payment of principal, interest, fees, or other related amounts towards fulfillment of a debt obligation
name: actual payment of principal, interest, fees, or other related amounts towards fulfillment of a debt obligation

id: Note that there are a number of variations for ownership interest that represent 'corner cases', including jurisdiction-specific variants, which can be added as needed for specific applications.
name: Note that there are a number of variations for ownership interest that represent 'corner cases', including jurisdiction-specific variants, which can be added as needed for specific applications.

id: Loans.rdf version of this ontology was modified to eliminate a subproperty relationship between the principal and notional amount, which may not be appropriate (DER-127) and to replace content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).
name: Loans.rdf version of this ontology was modified to eliminate a subproperty relationship between the principal and notional amount, which may not be appropriate (DER-127) and to replace content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).

id: In cases where a loan has been securitized, the servicer is also responsible for forwarding payments to investors, filing reports with credit-rating agencies and investors, and so forth.
name: In cases where a loan has been securitized, the servicer is also responsible for forwarding payments to investors, filing reports with credit-rating agencies and investors, and so forth.

id: This is particularly important for secondary loans, or for refinancing that combines outstanding loans against a given asset. Lenders use this ratio to evaluate the risk of extending a loan to a borrower(s) in cases where multiple loans are involved.
name: This is particularly important for secondary loans, or for refinancing that combines outstanding loans against a given asset. Lenders use this ratio to evaluate the risk of extending a loan to a borrower(s) in cases where multiple loans are involved.

id: or fees (e.g. 4 units * a unit price)
name: or fees (e.g. 4 units * a unit price)

id: Credit card and overdraft lines of credit are among the most widely used forms of open-end credit.
name: Credit card and overdraft lines of credit are among the most widely used forms of open-end credit.

id: account held by the borrower associated with a specific loan
name: account held by the borrower associated with a specific loan

id: record of actual payments of principal, interest, and other related amounts made by a borrower to a lender or servicer in order to fulfill their re-payment obligation
name: record of actual payments of principal, interest, and other related amounts made by a borrower to a lender or servicer in order to fulfill their re-payment obligation

id: links an actual payment of principal, interest, and other related amounts to the overall payment history for an account
name: links an actual payment of principal, interest, and other related amounts to the overall payment history for an account

id: classification indicating that several parties may share in, and mitigate the risk of, ownership of a high-value tangible asset
name: classification indicating that several parties may share in, and mitigate the risk of, ownership of a high-value tangible asset

id: party that collects principal and interest payments on behalf of the lender
name: party that collects principal and interest payments on behalf of the lender

id: indicates whether the contractual terms include or would have included a feature that allows unpaid interest to be added to the balance of unpaid principal
name: indicates whether the contractual terms include or would have included a feature that allows unpaid interest to be added to the balance of unpaid principal

id: Loans.rdf version of this ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC), eliminating redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.
name: Loans.rdf version of this ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC), eliminating redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.

id: relates a credit agreement, loan, or commitment to any history of payments that have been made by the borrower up to the point that payment history is requested
name: relates a credit agreement, loan, or commitment to any history of payments that have been made by the borrower up to the point that payment history is requested

id: A loan guarantee is a promise by one party to assume the debt obligation of a borrower if that borrower defaults. A guarantee can be limited or unlimited, making the guarantor liable for only a portion or all of the debt.
name: A loan guarantee is a promise by one party to assume the debt obligation of a borrower if that borrower defaults. A guarantee can be limited or unlimited, making the guarantor liable for only a portion or all of the debt.

id: indicates whether the contractual terms include or would have included interest only payments
name: indicates whether the contractual terms include or would have included interest only payments

id: party that signs a borrower's promissory note, providing additional security and potentially improving the quality of the debt
name: party that signs a borrower's promissory note, providing additional security and potentially improving the quality of the debt

id: In the U.S., the term 'guaranteed loan' typically refers to a loan that is backed by a federal agency, such as the Department of Veterans Affairs or the Small Business Administration. Student loans may be guaranteed by the Student Loan Marketing Association.
name: In the U.S., the term 'guaranteed loan' typically refers to a loan that is backed by a federal agency, such as the Department of Veterans Affairs or the Small Business Administration. Student loans may be guaranteed by the Student Loan Marketing Association.

id: Fee simple is the term used to represent the maximum ownership interest in real property that is allowed under the law. It can be referred to as 'complete ownership'.
name: Fee simple is the term used to represent the maximum ownership interest in real property that is allowed under the law. It can be referred to as 'complete ownership'.

id: indicates a form of pre-paid interest, charged by the lender as an alternative to charging a higher rate of interest on the mortgage loan
name: indicates a form of pre-paid interest, charged by the lender as an alternative to charging a higher rate of interest on the mortgage loan

id: the principal balance of all loans secured by the property
name: the principal balance of all loans secured by the property

id: Prepayment may or may not involve refinancing with the same lender. Prepayment terms include any prepayment penalty period, penalty amount and whether or not there is provision for waiver of the penalty, and any conditions related to making additional payments or payments over and above the expected installment payment over the lifetime of the loan.
name: Prepayment may or may not involve refinancing with the same lender. Prepayment terms include any prepayment penalty period, penalty amount and whether or not there is provision for waiver of the penalty, and any conditions related to making additional payments or payments over and above the expected installment payment over the lifetime of the loan.

id: specifies a period of time in months after origination during which the interest rate cannot change
name: specifies a period of time in months after origination during which the interest rate cannot change

id: indicates the balance with respect to the principal on the loan as of some date
name: indicates the balance with respect to the principal on the loan as of some date

id: loan that is secured with respect to repayment of principal and interest by guaranty
name: loan that is secured with respect to repayment of principal and interest by guaranty

id: has amount payable for principal, interest, fees or other expenses
name: has amount payable for principal, interest, fees or other expenses
